result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua R Hopkins

records.addlTxt: KC left a voicemail for the defendant on 10/28/22 at 3:50 pm letting him know that Attorney Vruwink was appointed on his case
Court appoints Aaron Vruwink as counsel. Defendant must pay $100 per month commencing 11/1/22. Must pay by wage assignment, if possible.
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant came to the Branch 3 window.  He stated that he does not have a new address, as he has been staying at different hotels.  A copy of his preliminary hearing notice was handed to the defendant at the window on 10/27/22. KC

11:25 AM Defendant Joshua R Hopkins not in court.  Attorney Austin M Mogard in court for State of Wisconsin. 
There is a question if defendant received his notice of today's hearing as it was sent to him in jail. The notice came back to the Court because he posted his cash bond and it was mailed to him on Monday.
Court finds good cause to go outside the time limits for preliminary hearing.
Attorney Mogard states that Victim/Witness has complied with order at last hearing.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on November 14, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
No contact with victim or their residence - AMH. $500.

Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on October 26, 2022 at 11:15 am.

***Notice of hearing was returned from the Wood County Jail on 10/24/22- Remailed to defendant on 10/24/22 KC***
No contact w/victim or their residence - AMH

2:20 PM Defendant Joshua R Hopkins appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Austin M Mogard in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Faith Storms appears in court for the defendant. Court finds probable cause to continue this matter. This will be bound over for preliminary hearing and arraignment. Bond is set. Bond needs to be looked at again when there is contact made with the victim.
